title: Detailed manuscript plan for a 1944 church service and party organised for 122nd Field Regiment (2 pieces) 1944 Church service and Christmas greeting card

  title_text: Detailed manuscript plan for a 1944 church service and party organised for 122nd Field Regiment (2 pieces) 1944 Church service and Christmas greeting card

  physical_appearance: This is a Christmas greeting card relating to a church service. It is handdrawn and handwritten in multicolored ink. There is a logo drawn at the top-center of the card. On the left
 there is a box describing an order of church services. On the right
 the location and year is written. There are no tears on the card.

  sgcool_label_text: This is a detailed manuscript plan for a 1944 church service and party organised for 122nd Field Regiment written on the verso of a typed memo from Singapore Inspector of Prisons (1938)
 with Steele\u0027s manuscript invitation. This artefact is part of the archive of James Steele
 Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942
 when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.

metadata.title_text: Detailed manuscript plan for a 1944 church service and party organised for 122nd Field Regiment (2 pieces) 1944 Church service and Christmas greeting card
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a Christmas greeting card relating to a church service. It is handdrawn and handwritten in multicolored ink. There is a logo drawn at the top-center of the card. On the left, there is a box describing an order of church services. On the right, the location and year is written. There are no tears on the card.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This is a detailed manuscript plan for a 1944 church service and party organised for 122nd Field Regiment written on the verso of a typed memo from Singapore Inspector of Prisons (1938), with Steele's manuscript invitation. This artefact is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
